TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . The respondent Government were represented by Mr PERSON , their Agent .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE ORG in PERSON accused the applicant of fraud and brought criminal proceedings against him . On DATE ORG in PERSON dismissed the applicant ’s complaint against this decision .
The applicant was examined by the police investigator on DATE and on DATE .
On DATE the applicant refused to be examined as his lawyer was ill .
Another examination was held on DATE . It had to be adjourned as the applicant had health problems .
Examinations were scheduled for DATE , DATE and DATE . On DATE the applicant refused to answer further questions as his complaint about the investigator had not been decided upon .
At the examination held on DATE the applicant availed himself of his right not to answer the investigator ’s questions .
On DATE the applicant was allowed to consult the case file and he was examined by the investigator .

In a report of CARDINAL DATE a public prosecutor noted that the length of the preliminary proceedings was due to the fact that documentary evidence had to be obtained from GPE . The report stated that it had been difficult to contact the witnesses during DATE and that the applicant and his lawyer had also contributed to the length of the proceedings . The police was instructed to conclude the investigation before DATE .
On DATE the applicant requested the public prosecutor to order further evidence to be taken .

On DATE the applicant was questioned for TIME . Subsequently he decided to remain silent and refused to have his handwriting examined by an expert as an expert opinion to the same effect had already been ordered .
On DATE the applicant challenged an expert . The public prosecutor dismissed the request on CARDINAL DATE .
On DATE the public prosecutor filed an indictment with ORG súd ) .

On DATE ORG returned the case to the public prosecutor . ORG shared the applicant ’s view that the case had not been properly investigated into and ordered further comprehensive evidence to be taken . On DATE ORG ( PERSON súd ) dismissed the public prosecutor ’s complaint against ORG decision . On DATE the case file was returned to ORG and it reached the police investigator on DATE .

On DATE and on DATE respectively the applicant challenged the officials dealing with his case and complained about shortcomings in the examination of a witness . On DATE ORG in GPE found that the investigators were not excluded .

A reconstitution of the alleged offence was scheduled for DATE . It did not take place as the applicant objected that several witnesses were absent . The reconstitution was held on DATE . The applicant challenged the way in which it was carried out and proposed further evidence to be taken .

On DATE the applicant complained to the public prosecutor that the police investigator lacked impartiality . On DATE the public prosecutor instructed the investigator to remedy shortcomings in the proceedings .
On DATE another reconstitution of the alleged offence was carried out .
On DATE a witness was heard and confronted with the applicant in GPE . The applicant challenged the examination .
On DATE an expert was appointed at the applicant ’s request .
Another confrontation of the applicant with a witness in GPE was scheduled for DATE . In TIME of the same day the lawyer informed the police that the applicant was ill and that he could not attend .
On DATE the applicant challenged all PERSON police investigators . On DATE ORG refused to exclude the PERSON police investigators from dealing with the case .
On DATE the applicant challenged the public prosecutor involved in his case . On DATE ORG dismissed the request .
On DATE the applicant challenged the police investigators and the public prosecutor dealing with his case . The case file was submitted to ORG .

On DATE ORG discontinued the criminal proceedings on the ground that the applicant had committed no offence . The person who had filed the criminal complaint against the applicant lodged a complaint which was dismissed by ORG . The decision to discontinue the criminal proceedings against the applicant thus became final on DATE .
